Practice Exercises - Index

A comprehensive collection of practice exercises organized by topic to help you master C#/.NET development and prepare for senior-level technical interviews.

How to Use This Guide

  1. Start with fundamentals - Build a strong foundation
  2. Practice coding exercises - Write actual code, don't just read
  3. Time yourself - Simulate interview conditions
  4. Explain out loud - Practice articulating your thought process
  5. Review answers - Understand why each solution works
  6. Iterate - Come back to difficult topics multiple times

---

Core C# & .NET Topics

C# Fundamentals

Master the core language features and common patterns.

  • Value vs Reference Types
  • Access Modifiers & Encapsulation
  • Generics & Constraints
  • Delegates, Events, and Lambda Expressions
  • LINQ Expressions
  • Pattern Matching
  • Records and Modern C# Features

Difficulty: Beginner to Intermediate | Exercises: 30+

LINQ & Collections

Deep dive into LINQ queries and collection manipulation.

  • IEnumerable vs IQueryable
  • LINQ Query Syntax vs Method Syntax
  • Deferred vs Immediate Execution
  • SelectMany and Complex Projections
  • GroupBy and Aggregations
  • Custom LINQ Extensions
  • Performance Considerations

Difficulty: Intermediate | Exercises: 25+

Async & Resilience

Master asynchronous programming and resilient patterns.

  • Task-based Asynchronous Pattern (TAP)
  • Async/Await Best Practices
  • Cancellation and Timeouts
  • Parallel Programming
  • Channels and Pipelines
  • Retry Policies (Polly)
  • Circuit Breakers
  • Backpressure Handling

Difficulty: Intermediate to Advanced | Exercises: 30+

Performance & Memory Management

Optimize code for performance and memory efficiency.

  • Memory Allocation (Stack vs Heap)
  • Garbage Collection Strategies
  • Span and Memory
  • Object Pooling
  • ValueTask vs Task
  • Zero-Allocation Patterns
  • BenchmarkDotNet Usage
  • Profiling and Diagnostics

Difficulty: Advanced | Exercises: 25+

---

Architecture & Design

API & Lifecycle

Build robust and maintainable APIs.

  • ASP.NET Core Middleware Pipeline
  • Dependency Injection Patterns
  • API Versioning
  • Rate Limiting & Throttling
  • Authentication & Authorization
  • Health Checks & Readiness Probes
  • Request Validation
  • Error Handling Middleware

Difficulty: Intermediate | Exercises: 20+

System Design

Design scalable, distributed systems.

  • Microservices Architecture
  • Event-Driven Design
  • CQRS and Event Sourcing
  • Message Queues and Streaming
  • Caching Strategies
  • Database Scaling
  • Observability and Monitoring
  • High-Availability Patterns

Difficulty: Advanced | Exercises: 15+

Messaging & Integration

Integrate systems using message-based communication.

  • Message Queue Patterns (RabbitMQ, Kafka)
  • At-Least-Once vs Exactly-Once Delivery
  • Saga Pattern
  • Outbox Pattern
  • Idempotency
  • Message Serialization
  • Dead Letter Queues
  • Event Streaming

Difficulty: Advanced | Exercises: 20+

---

Data & Persistence

Data Layer

Master database access and optimization.

  • Entity Framework Core
  • Dapper and Micro-ORMs
  • SQL Query Optimization
  • Indexes (Clustered, Non-Clustered, Covering)
  • Window Functions
  • Transactions and Isolation Levels
  • Read Replicas
  • Database Migrations

Difficulty: Intermediate to Advanced | Exercises: 25+

---

Domain-Specific

Trading Domain Knowledge

Specialized exercises for financial/trading systems.

  • Trade Lifecycle
  • Market Data Processing
  • Order Execution Workflows
  • Risk Management
  • MT4/MT5 Integration
  • Price Streaming
  • Real-Time Data Handling
  • Reconciliation

Difficulty: Advanced | Exercises: 15+

---

Coding Challenges

Code Assessment Exercises

Real-world coding problems similar to technical interviews.

  • Algorithm Implementation
  • Data Structure Design
  • Performance Optimization
  • Concurrent Programming
  • API Design
  • Security Best Practices
  • Code Refactoring
  • Bug Fixing

Difficulty: All Levels | Exercises: 35+

---

Behavioral & Communication

Behavioral Questions

Practice articulating your experience and soft skills.

  • STAR Method Examples
  • Leadership Scenarios
  • Conflict Resolution
  • Technical Decision Making
  • Process Improvement
  • Mentoring & Knowledge Sharing
  • Questions for Interviewers

Difficulty: All Levels | Scenarios: 20+

---

Quick Reference

Common Patterns Cheat Sheet

Quick reference for frequently used patterns and idioms.

Interview Prep Checklist

Last-minute review before your interview.

---

Study Strategy

For 1-Week Prep

  • Days 1-2: C# Fundamentals, LINQ & Collections
  • Days 3-4: Async & Resilience, API & Lifecycle
  • Days 5-6: System Design, Code Assessment
  • Day 7: Review weak areas, Behavioral prep

For 2-Week Prep

  • Week 1: All Core Topics + Data Layer
  • Week 2: Architecture, Domain-Specific, Practice Coding Challenges

For 1-Month Prep

  • Week 1: C# Fundamentals, LINQ, Collections
  • Week 2: Async, Performance, Memory
  • Week 3: Architecture, System Design, APIs
  • Week 4: Domain-Specific, Full Mock Interviews, Review

---

Progress Tracking

Create a copy of this checklist to track your progress:

- [ ] C# Fundamentals (0/30)
- [ ] LINQ & Collections (0/25)
- [ ] Async & Resilience (0/30)
- [ ] Performance & Memory (0/25)
- [ ] API & Lifecycle (0/20)
- [ ] System Design (0/15)
- [ ] Messaging & Integration (0/20)
- [ ] Data Layer (0/25)
- [ ] Trading Domain (0/15)
- [ ] Code Assessment (0/35)
- [ ] Behavioral Questions (0/20)

---

Total Exercises: 260+

Start with topics you're least comfortable with, then reinforce your strengths. Good luck!

Built for disciplined study & interview drills.
